juzzyPython.type1.sets package

juzzyPython.type1.sets.T1MF_Cylinder module

T1MF_Cylinder.py Created 10/12/2021

class juzzyPython.type1.sets.T1MF_Cylinder.T1MF_Cylinder(name: str, membershipDegree: float)[source]

Bases: juzzyPython.type1.sets.T1MF_Prototype.T1MF_Prototype

Class T1MF_Cylinder The T1MF_Cylinder class is mainly a support class for the IT2 class. It serves to implement the cylindrical extension of a firing strength. In terms of a type-1 MF, a cylinder is in fact just a singleton over the whole universe of discourse.

Parameters: Name: Name of the variable Membership Degree: The value for the membership degree of the “cylinder” (for all x)

Functions:

getFS getAlphaCut toString compareTo getPeak

compareTo(o: object) → int[source]

Unsupported method

getAlphaCut(alpha: float) → juzzyPython.generic.Tuple.Tuple[source]

Transform into basic belief assignment

getFS(x: float) → float[source]

Return the membership degree

getPeak() → float[source]

Unsupported method

toString() → str[source]

Return function to string

juzzyPython.type1.sets.T1MF_Discretized module

T1MF_Discretized.py Created 11/12/2021

class juzzyPython.type1.sets.T1MF_Discretized.T1MF_Discretized(name: str, points: Optional[List[juzzyPython.generic.Tuple.Tuple]] = None)[source]

Bases: juzzyPython.type1.sets.T1MF_Prototype.T1MF_Prototype

Class T1MF_Discretized The class allows the specification of a type-1 MF based on single points alone, i.e. in a discretised fashion. The points are specified using y-x coordinates. All points are held in a list which requires resorting as points are added.

Parameters: Name: Name of the membership function InitialSize: An int defining the size of the list

Functions:

addPoint addPoints getAlphaCutDiscretizationLevel setAlphaCutDiscretizationLevel getNumberOfPoints getFS getAlphaCut Interpolate getPoints getPointAt getPeak getSupport toString sort writeToFile writeToFileHighRes setLeftShoulderSet setRightShoulderSet getDefuzzifiedCentroid compareTo

addPoint(p: juzzyPython.generic.Tuple.Tuple) → None[source]

Adds a point to the discretized set - forces resorting. (add array of points in one go to avoid sorting overhead)

p 2-D coordinates of the point in the order y,x.

addPoints(ps: List[juzzyPython.generic.Tuple.Tuple]) → None[source]

Adds a series of points to the discretized set - forces resorting. p 2-D coordinates of the points in the order y,x.

compareTo(o: object) → int[source]
getAlphaCut(alpha: float) → juzzyPython.generic.Tuple.Tuple[source]

Returns the x values where the alpha cut using the alpha (y) value provided “cuts” the function curve

getAlphaCutDiscretizationLevel() → int[source]

Return the current alpha cut discretization level

getDefuzzifiedCentroid(numberOfDiscretizations: Optional[int] = None) → float[source]

Returns the defuzzified value of this set computed using the centroid algorithm. numberOfDiscretizations The number of discretizations to be employed. The number of discretizations is not used - instead the centroid is computed on all the discrete values in the set.

getFS(x: float) → float[source]

Return the membership degree

getNumberOfPoints() → int[source]

Get the length of the set

getPeak() → float[source]

Returns the xCoordinate of the peak value. If the set has a “flat top”, i.e. similar to a trapezoidal MF, then the center of this flat top is returned. Assumes convexity.

getPointAt(index: int) → juzzyPython.generic.Tuple.Tuple[source]

Return a sorted point in the set

getPoints() → List[juzzyPython.generic.Tuple.Tuple][source]

Return all the points in the set

getSupport() → juzzyPython.generic.Tuple.Tuple[source]

Returns a new tuple depending on shoulder

interpolate(x0: int, x1: float, x2: int) → float[source]

Calculate f(s) for input x through interpolation x0 = Identifier pointing to correct x0 in set list x1 = x input x2 = Identifier pointing to correct x2 in set list

setAlphaCutDiscretizationLevel(level: int) → None[source]

Set a new alpha cut discretization level

setLeftShoulderSet(shoulderStart: float) → None[source]

Set the left shoulder of the set

setRightShoulderSet(shoulderStart: float) → None[source]

Set the right shoulder of the set

sort() → None[source]

Sorts the list holding all points defining the set. No sort is performed if the set is already sorted.

toString() → str[source]

Converts the full set into a printable string

writeToFile(filename: str) → str[source]

Write out the discretized set into a file

writeToFileHighRes(filename: str, resolution: int) → str[source]

Uses interpolation to supply high-res visualisation of the set.

juzzyPython.type1.sets.T1MF_Gauangle module

T1MF_Gauangle.py Created 18/12/2021

class juzzyPython.type1.sets.T1MF_Gauangle.T1MF_Gauangle(name: str, start: float, center: float, end: float)[source]

Bases: juzzyPython.type1.sets.T1MF_Prototype.T1MF_Prototype

Class T1MF_Gauangle Class for Gauangle Type-1 Fuzzy Membership Functions. The Gauangle MF combines the smooth “peak” of Gaussian MFs with the linearly decreasing “sides” of triangular MFs.

Parameters

  • name – Name of the set

  • start – Start as for triangular MF.

  • center – Center as for triangular MF

  • end – End as for triangular MF.

Functions:

getFS getPeak getMean getStart getEnd toString getLineEquationParameters getXForYOnLine compareTo getAlphaCut

compareTo(o: object) → int[source]

Compare to another gauangle object

getAlphaCut(alpha: float) → juzzyPython.generic.Tuple.Tuple[source]

Unsupported Function

getEnd() → float[source]

Return the end of the set

getFS(x: float) → float[source]

Return the maximum FS between two sets

getLineEquationParameters(x: juzzyPython.generic.Tuple.Tuple, y: juzzyPython.generic.Tuple.Tuple) → List[float][source]

returns the line equation parameters a and be (line equation = ax*b) for a line passing through the points defined by the tuples x and y. The first point (x), the Tuple consists of the x and y coordinates of the point in this order. The second point (y), the Tuple consists of the x and y coordinates of the point in this order.

getMean() → float[source]

Return the mean of the set

getPeak() → float[source]

Return the peak of the set

getStart() → float[source]

Return the start of the set

getXForYOnLine(y: float, ab: List[float]) → float[source]

Returns the x coordinate for a specified y coordinate when considering the given line equation.

toString() → str[source]

Convert membership function to string

Class T1MF_Singleton Membership Function represented by a single double value - for example heavily used in TSK/Anfis for consequents.

Parameters

  • value – the value where the singleton exists

  • name – the name of the membership function

juzzyPython.type1.sets.T1MF_Trapezoidal module

T1MF_Trapezoidal.py Created 17/12/2021

class juzzyPython.type1.sets.T1MF_Trapezoidal.T1MF_Trapezoidal(name: str, parameters: List[float], yLevels: Optional[List[float]] = None)[source]

Bases: juzzyPython.type1.sets.T1MF_Prototype.T1MF_Prototype

Class T1MF_Trapezoidal Class for Trapezoidal Type-1 Fuzzy Membership Functions. The parameters of the MF are defined from left to right as a,b,c and d. The MF supports both normal MFs where the membership between b and c is 1.0, as well as non-normal MFs where this membership can be specified freely.

Parameters

  • right (parameters = Parameters list from left to) –

  • Normally (yLevels= The specific yLevels for the second and third point of the trapezoid.) –

  • equal. (both values are) –

Functions:

getFS getA getB getC getD getParameters getPeak setPeak getyLevels setyLevels compareTo getAlphaCut findLinearEquationParameters toString

compareTo(o: object) → int[source]

Compare to another trapezoidal object

findLinearEquationParameters() → None[source]

Finds the slopes and intercepts for the left and right “leg” of the membership function. If the parameters for the given set have previously been computed, the method returns directly.

getA() → float[source]

Return the a parameter of the function

getAlphaCut(alpha: float) → juzzyPython.generic.Tuple.Tuple[source]

Get the alpha cut as a tuple

getB() → float[source]

Return the b parameter of the function

getC() → float[source]

Return the c parameter of the function

getD() → float[source]

Return the c parameter of the function

getFS(x: float) → float[source]

Return the maximum FS between two sets

getParameters() → List[float][source]

Returns the MFs parameters Return a list of type float, holding all 4 parameters in order from left to right.

getPeak() → float[source]

As standard, the peak is generally defined as the average of b and c, however it may be changed using the setPeak() method if desired. Return The peak of either as average of b and c or as specified.

getyLevels() → List[float][source]

Retrieves the yLevels of the second and third parameters (points B and C) This is useful for non-normal MFs. returns The degrees of membership of the inner parameters of the MF.

setPeak(peak: float) → None[source]

Set the peak

setyLevels(levels: List[float]) → None[source]

Set the y levels

toString() → str[source]

Convert membership function to string
